abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Irrigation
            Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project of Macedonia were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: 1) Farmers'
            participation in the design of rehabilitation works and
            management of irrigation system is a pre-requisite for
            achieving sustainability in the irrigation sub-sector; 2)
            Decentralization of irrigation management is a long and
            continuous process; 3) It is very important that the
            government of Macedonia remains true to the reform process
            to create confidence and political support for improving the
            irrigation sub-sector; 4) Irrigation is only one input to
            increasing agriculture productivity; and 5) Implementation
            through Project Implementation Units can reduce potential
            impacts on institutional development.
